intro: Aechmea alegrensis, commonly known as the São Paulo pineapple bromeliad, is a striking epiphytic plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a central cup to collect rainwater. The plant produces strikingly colorful inflorescences with showy bracts that range from red to orange. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. Aechmea alegrensis is popular in horticulture for its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
